greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = (-1)^Omega(n) if n is not a perfect power > 1, and 0 otherwise.
comment: Omega(n) = A001222(n) is the number of prime factors of n counted with multiplicity.
example: Agrees with Moebius function A008683 except for numbers like 12, 18, .... Moebius(12) = 0, a(12) = (-1)^3 = -1. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 26 2018
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, May 18 2018
